Function Documentation

bool usart0_available ( void   ) 

Gets the receive buffer count This can be used as a boolean since if the buffer is empty it returns 0.

Example: 

        char *c;

        if(usart0_available())
        {
                if(usart0_get_char(c)) usart0_put_char(*c);
                usart0_send(); // Starts buffer tansmission
        }
Returns:
receive buffer count.

        {
            usart_mode_asynchronous = 0,
            usart_mode_synchronous = 1
        } usart_mode_t;

            baud_1200 = 1200,
            baud_2400 = 2400,
            baud_4800 = 4800,

                baud_57600 = 57600 // 3/17/11 JWP

        typedef enum
        {
            5-bit = 5,
            6-bit = 6,
            7-bit = 7,
                8-bit = 8,
                9-bit = 9
        } usart_databits_t;

        typedef enum
        {
            1-stopbit = 1,
            2-stopbit = 6,
        } usart_stopbits_t;

        {
            parity_none = 0,
                uparity_even = 1,
            uparity_odd = 2
        } usart_parity_t;

        typedef enum
        {
            flow_none = 0,
            flow_sw = 1,
            flow_hw = 2
        } usart_flow_control_t;

void usart0_init_baud ( uint32_t  baud  ) 

intializes the uart the baudrate and parameters with defaults: 8 data bits, no parity, one stop bit, and no handshaking

Parameters:
baud 
        typedef enum
        {
            baud_1200 = 1200,
            baud_2400 = 2400,
            baud_4800 = 4800,
            baud_9600 = 9600,
            baud_19200 = 19200,
            baud_38400 = 38400,
                baud_57600 = 57600 // 3/17/11 JWP
        } usart_baud_t;

void usart0_put_string ( char *  str  ) 

Puts a '' terminated string into the transmit buffer. To prevent buffer overrun, the string is automatically truncated with ''if it exceeds USART0_TRANSMIT_BUFFER_LEN - 1.

Parameters:
*str pointer to a char buffer

Definition at line 42 of file usart0_put_string.c.

void usart0_receive_buffer_clear ( void   ) 

This clear function will reset the receive buffer head_index and tail_index to 0. The count value is also set to 0. A memset command is used to reset a particular area in memory as well.

Example: 

        void end_this()
        {
                usart0_receive__buffer_clear();
        }

Definition at line 41 of file usart0_receive_buffer_clear.c.

uint8_t usart0_receive_buffer_free_count ( void   ) 

Receive buffer counter initialization.

Example: 

        uint8_t free;

        free = usart0_receive_buffer_free_count();
Returns:
receive buffer size minus receive buffer count

Definition at line 41 of file usart0_receive_buffer_free_count.c.

uint8_t usart0_receive_buffer_inuse_count ( void   ) 

Gets the receive buffer count.

Returns:
receive buffer count.

Example: 

        while(1)
                // Ping back received values
                if(usart0_available())
                {
                        count = usart0_receive_buffer_inuse_count();

                        for(int i = 0 ; i < count; i++)
                        {
                                usart0_transmit_buffer_insert(usart0_receive_buffer_remove());
                        }       
                        usart0_send();          
                }
        }

Definition at line 41 of file usart0_receive_buffer_inuse_count.c.

uint8_t usart0_receive_buffer_peek ( uint8_t *  buf,
uint8_t  count 
)

Looks at a number of bytes of data in the receive buffer.

Example: 

        uint8_t peekByte = 0;

        peekByte = usart0_receive_peek();
Parameters:
*buf pointer a buffer to hold the bytes requested
count The number of bytes to look at.
Returns:
Total bytes read

Definition at line 41 of file usart0_receive_buffer_peek.c.

uint8_t usart0_receive_buffer_remove ( void   ) 

Data is retreived from the receive buffer. Upon retrieval, the buffer index is decremented.

Returns:
tail data byte

Example: 

        \\ Remove a byte from the receive buffer and put it in the transmit buffer
        sart0_transmit_buffer_insert(usart0_receive_buffer_remove());

Definition at line 41 of file usart0_receive_buffer_remove.c.

void usart0_send ( void   ) 

Initiates the interrupt based transmission of the buffer NOTE: All of the put or insert function only load a byte into the transmission buffer. This function must be called to start the transmission.

Example: 

        // Put a string from program memory into the transmit buffer
        usart0_put_pgm_string(pgm_str1);
        // Initiate buffer transmission
        usart0_send();

Definition at line 432 of file usart0.c.

void usart0_transmit_buffer_clear ( void   ) 

This clear function will reset the transmit buffer head_index and tail_index to 0. The count value is also set to 0. A memset command is used to reset a particular area in memory as well.

Example: 

        void end_this()
        {
                usart0_transmit_buffer_clear();
        }

Definition at line 41 of file usart0_transmit_buffer_clear.c.

uint8_t usart0_transmit_buffer_free_count ( void   ) 

Transmit buffer counter initialization.

Example: 

        uint8_t free;

        free = usart0_transmit_buffer_free_count();
Returns:
Transmit buffer size minus receive buffer count

Definition at line 41 of file usart0_transmit_buffer_free_count.c.

bool usart0_transmit_buffer_insert ( uint8_t  c  ) 

Adds the byte 'c' to the transmit buffer and returns True if it was able to add the byte, False otherwise.

Note:
Data added will be one value less than the size of the defined receive buffer. An example of this is a buffer size of [10] will only allow 9 values to be added into the buffer

Example: 

        \\ Add a string termination character
        usart0_transmit_buffer_insert('\0');
Parameters:
c byte to add
Returns:
boolean result of attempt to add byte

Definition at line 41 of file usart0_transmit_buffer_insert.c.

uint8_t usart0_transmit_buffer_inuse_count ( void   ) 

Gets the transmit buffer count.

Example: 

        if(usart0_transmit_buffer_inuse_count())// Is there data in the buffer?
        {
                // Send next byte in the buffer.
              UART_DATA_REG = ring_remove(&usart0_transmit_ring);
        }
Returns:
Transmit buffer count.

Definition at line 41 of file usart0_transmit_buffer_inuse_count.c.

uint8_t usart0_transmit_buffer_peek ( uint8_t *  buf,
uint8_t  count 
)

Looks at a number of bytes of data in the transmit buffer.

Example: 

        uint8_t myBuf[10];
        uint8_t toGet = 10;
        uint8_t got = 0;

        got = usart0_transmit_buffer_peek(myBuf, toGet);
        if(got != get)
        {
                \\ didn't get requested bytes
        }
        else
        }
                \\got requested bytes 
                ...
        }
Parameters:
*buf pointer a buffer to hold the bytes requested
count The number of bytes to look at.
Returns:
Total bytes read

Definition at line 41 of file usart0_transmit_buffer_peek.c.

uint8_t usart0_transmit_buffer_remove ( void   ) 

Data is retreived from the transmit buffer. Upon retrieval, the buffer index is decremented.

Example: 

        char c;

        c = usart0_transmit_buffer_remove();
Returns:
tail data byte

Looks at the tail byte of data in the Transmit buffer.

Example: 

        uint8_t peekByte = 0;

        peekByte = usart0_transmit_peek();
Returns:
Transmit buffer tail byte

void usart0_uninit ( void   ) 

Restores registers to datasheet default valuse.

Example: 

        // Stop the madness
        usart0_uninit();
